An important point that we need to discuss is the stacking of 2D COFs, i.e., the arrangement of neighboring layers, sticking together because of noncovalent interactions. Reviewing the experimental literature about the synthesis and characterization of COFs,
2, 4, 31 we found that it is common to consider just two types of stacking: the eclipsed AA stacking, where the different layers are perfectly superimposed, and the staggered AB stacking, where there is an alternation of even and odd layers with an offset in the xy plane. Figure 4 shows as example these two configuration for COF-1 and COF-5.
